title: Patch 6.22 Preseason Shop Size Issues
body: Once the patch was released for the preseason my shop has become insanely big, I am on a 2560x1440 on Fullscreen. Previous to the patch my icons were about 1/2 of the size that they are currently and it is unplayable. I have already tried to change around the settings of the shop size in the files **game.cfg** file and the **PersistedSettings.json** and then the changes just reverted back into the shitty massive shop as soon as i got into game.

replies.body:
Same issue.

The tray starts in full-screen at log-in. Try to move the tray at login or after login and a quarter of the tray (from the left) disappears. Settings menu and exit button at top left not visible in either size.

Additionally, the tray will not go back to full screen as the options for that are off the screen, before and after it changes sizes.

Minimizing from the taskbar, or alt-tabing out and back to the tray will shorten the size as well

I have exactly the same issue. Using a 2560x1440 Screen and since the latest patch the ingame Shop is just too Large.

Did anyone already find a solution to this?

Your resolution may be too big to support, especially if you're on a 4K.  Modifying your files this way likely caused more troubles than resolved, so as a first step I recommend resetting your configuration to default:

 **Log into the game** then hop into **a custom game**. *Alt+Tab* out of the match, then navigate to your League installation folder, which should be in C:\Riot Games\League of Legends

Delete the folder named **Config**

Once you've deleted the folder, leave the custom match. You'll then want to hop into another custom match to confirm the changes were saved.

I also recommend setting your DPI to 100% to help with the icons and text:
Right click the LoL icon -> Properties -> Compatibility Tab -> Check the "Disable Display Scaling on High DPI Settings" Box.

Hope those steps help out!
